segments.source_content: Handsontable is [a feature-rich data grid](https://handsontable.com/demo?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=twirsep11) designed for React developers who need a powerful, customizable, and accessible solution to manage complex data.

segments.source_content:
- A unique **spreadsheet-like interface** with sorting, filtering, and CRUD operations
- Advanced operations like conditional formatting and **400 built-in formulas**, similar to Excel
- **Customizable editors and renderers**, allowing dropdowns, menus or custom components within grid cells to fit specific use cases
- **Optimized performance** for smooth and responsive interactions
- **Accessibility with WCAG 2.1 compliance** for better support for users with disabilities

- **Performances optimisÃ©es** pour des interactions fluides
- **AccessibilitÃ© conforme WCAG 2.1** pour une meilleure prise en charge des utilisateurs en situation de handicap

- Une **interface type tableur** unique avec tri, filtrage et opÃ©rations CRUD

segments.source_content: Just in time for Next.js conf, Next.js 15 is officially released. There are no major changes since RC2, just a few stability fixes. In this v15:

translations.fr: Sorti juste avant Next.js Conf, Next.js 15 est officiellement publiÃ©. Aucun changement majeur depuis RC2, seulement des corrections de stabilitÃ©. Dans cette v15 :
translations.en: Sorti juste Ã  temps pour la conf Next.js, Next.js 15 est officiellement publiÃ©. Aucun changement majeur depuis RC2, seulement quelques correctifs de stabilitÃ©. Dans cette v15 :
translations.zh-hans: æ°é€¢ Next.js å¤§ä¼šï¼ŒNext.js 15 æ­£å¼å‘å¸ƒã€‚è‡ª RC2 ä»¥æ¥æ— é‡å¤§å˜æ›´ï¼Œä»…è¿›è¡Œäº†ç¨³å®šæ€§ä¿®å¤ã€‚æœ¬ç‰ˆæœ¬ç‰¹æ€§ï¼š

segments.source_content:
- The caching behavior is flipped with most things (eg `fetch` requests) not cached by default anymore.
- App router uses React 19 RC, pages router stays on React 18
- Using turbopack dev is now recommended (webpack is still supported)
- There are breaking changes such as existing APIs going async, and `@next/codemod upgrade` facilitates the upgrade

translations.fr:
- Le comportement de cache est inversÃ© : la plupart des Ã©lÃ©ments (ex: requÃªtes `fetch`) ne sont plus cachÃ©s par dÃ©faut
- Le routeur App utilise React 19 RC, le routeur Pages reste sur React 18
- Turbopack pour le dev est maintenant recommandÃ© (webpack toujours supportÃ©)
- Changements cassants comme des APIs devenant asynchrones, facilitÃ©s par `@next/codemod upgrade`
translations.en:
- Le comportement de cache est inversÃ© : la plupart des Ã©lÃ©ments (ex: requÃªtes `fetch`) ne sont plus mis en cache par dÃ©faut
- L'App Router utilise React 19 RC, le Pages Router reste sur React 18
- L'utilisation de Turbopack en dev est maintenant recommandÃ©e (webpack reste supportÃ©)
- Des changements cassants comme des API devenues asynchrones, et `@next/codemod upgrade` facilite la migration

segments.source_content: Thereâ€™s of course a slew of other DX, security and performance improvements.

translations.fr: Bien sÃ»r, une multitude d'autres amÃ©liorations DX, sÃ©curitÃ© et performances.
translations.en: Il y a bien sÃ»r une foule d'autres amÃ©liorations DX, sÃ©curitÃ© et performances.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Omlet â€“ Scan your repos and measure how and where components are used](https://omlet.dev/?utm_campaign=partner_this-week-in-react_newsletter-quick-link-oct-2024)
- ğŸ“Š [State of React 2024 - Survey is open](https://survey.devographics.com/en-US/survey/state-of-react/2024?source=this_week_in_react): Please don't forget to fill this year's survey. Seb has contributed to its design. We would appreciate if you answer that you read This Week In React at the end ğŸ˜‡.
- ğŸ“œ [Server Side State management in NextJS: a deep dive into React Cache](https://www.yoseph.tech/posts/nextjs/server-side-state-management-in-nextjs-a-deep-dive-into-react-cache): using `cache`, `unstable_cache`, and `patched fetch`, explaining how these tools can optimize state handling, reduce prop drilling, and simplify server-side code.
- ğŸ“œ [Framer Sites Now Become Interactive 50% Faster](https://www.framer.com/blog/sites-interactive-faster/): Faster hydration with granular Suspense.
- ğŸ“œ [Remix Todo App](https://www.udohjeremiah.com/blog/remix-todo-app-part-1-building-the-app-layout-and-structure): A detailed guide in 6 parts.
- ğŸ“œ [How Vercel adopted microfrontends](https://vercel.com/blog/how-vercel-adopted-microfrontends)
- ğŸ“œ [Perfectly Fitting Text to Container in React](https://sentry.engineering/blog/perfectly-fitting-text-to-container-in-react)
- ğŸ“œ [Creating a Keyboard Shortcut Hook in React](https://www.taniarascia.com/keyboard-shortcut-hook-react/)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Compiler beta](https://react.dev/blog/2024/10/21/react-compiler-beta-release): Itâ€™s already in use in tens of thousands of components at Meta, they now want community feedback. This release adds official support for React 17 and 18. You can already add the ESLint plugin to prepare your codebase. Library authors are advised to pre-compile their libs.
- ğŸ“¦ [React DevTools 6.0.1 - React Server Components support](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/main/packages/react-devtools/CHANGELOG.md#601): The React team fixed a few v6 bugs and then finally published this new version to the stores so that we can all easily install it.
- ğŸ“¦ [Turbopack Dev stable](https://nextjs.org/blog/turbopack-for-development-stable): A slow dev server has been a usual pain point when working with Next.js. Vercel has been working on a rust-based webpack replacement for 2 years, and itâ€™s finally safe to use on all projects that donâ€™t rely on unusual webpack plugins.
- ğŸ“¦ [nuqs 2.0 - Type-safe search params state manager](https://nuqs.47ng.com/blog/nuqs-2): Initially a Next.js query-string library, it is now opening up to other React frameworks with support for Remix, React Router... and also the brand new Next.js 15.
- ğŸ“¦ [Chakra UI 3.0](https://www.chakra-ui.com/blog/00-announcing-v3): A full rewrite, with more components, semantic tokens and better performance.
- ğŸ“¦ [react-render-stream-testing-library](https://github.com/testing-library/react-render-stream-testing-library): To make detailed, render-per-render assertions when testing components and hooks. In many cases it amounts to testing implementation details but it will be very useful for library authors or in perf-sensitive scenarios.
- ğŸ“¦ [shadcn/ui - Sidebar component](https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/components/sidebar)
- ğŸ“¦ [next-intl 3.22 - Incrementally moving forward](https://next-intl-docs.vercel.app/blog/next-intl-3-22)
- ğŸ“¦ [Fumadocs 14 - Docs framework that works on Next.js 15 App Router](https://fumadocs.vercel.app/blog/v14)
- ğŸ¥ [Theo - Next.js is hiding something...](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g4g2YUtjh9g): Early sneak peek of upcoming features not even mentioned in the Next.js 15 release post, including the `'use cache'` directive, `cacheTag()` and `cacheLife` APIs.
- ğŸ¥ [Tanner Linsley - An Early Glimpse of TanStack Start](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AuHqwQsf64o)
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington - What I Discovered When I Compared React and NextJS for Astro 5's Server Islands](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rCkhCG7n8sA)
- ğŸ”— [NextMaster - Highly performant replica of McMaster-Carr using Next.js](https://github.com/ethanniser/NextMaster): McMaster-Carr (US supply company) website has been trending on Twitter as being very fast. This repo is a modern Next.js 15 port, even faster.

segments.source_content: Lazar Nikolov and Sarah Guthals are hosting a free workshop on [Implementing Clean Architecture in Next.js](https://sentry.io/resources/clean-architecture-nextjs/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=paid-community&utm_campaign=debuggability-fy25q3-cleanarchworkshop&utm_content=newsletter-lazar-rsvp). It will dive deep into what clean architecture _actually_ is, what problems it solves, and how to implement it in a Next.js application with Sentry.

translations.fr: Lazar Nikolov et Sarah Guthals animent un atelier gratuit sur [la mise en Å“uvre de l'architecture propre dans Next.js](https://sentry.io/resources/clean-architecture-nextjs/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=paid-community&utm_campaign=debuggability-fy25q3-cleanarchworkshop&utm_content=newsletter-lazar-rsvp). Il explorera en profondeur ce qu'est rÃ©ellement l'architecture propre, les problÃ¨mes qu'elle rÃ©sout et comment la mettre en Å“uvre dans une application Next.js avec Sentry.
translations.en: Lazar Nikolov et Sarah Guthals animent un atelier gratuit sur [la mise en Å“uvre d'une architecture propre dans Next.js](https://sentry.io/resources/clean-architecture-nextjs/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=paid-community&utm_campaign=debuggability-fy25q3-cleanarchworkshop&utm_content=newsletter-lazar-rsvp). Ils exploreront ce qu'est rÃ©ellement une architecture propre, les problÃ¨mes qu'elle rÃ©sout, et comment la mettre en Å“uvre dans une application Next.js avec Sentry.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Stay up-to-date with React Native & Expo News with notJust Newsletter](https://www.notjust.dev/newsletter?utm_source=twir&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter)
- ğŸ‘€ [React Native PR - Support for CSS `display: contents`](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/pull/46584): Define views that have zero impact on the layout but to which you can still attach event handlers. One possible usage is in `GestureDetector` from `react-native-gesture-handler`, which relies on direct native views to handle touch gestures without affecting layout, to fix issues like automatic collapsing of views in components.
- ğŸ“– [React Native Docs - New 0.76 DevTools](https://reactnative.dev/docs/next/react-native-devtools)
- ğŸ“œ [React Nativeâ€™s New Architecture, The Tricky Parts](https://blog.swmansion.com/react-natives-new-architecture-the-tricky-parts-1-2-bb0c16950f2d): View flattening, View recycling, libraries support.
- ğŸ“œ [PostHog - How we built mobile replay (and why it took so long)](https://posthog.com/blog/mobile-session-replay): Their React Native SDK 3.2 now has support for session replay (beta).
